wording:
It is alleged that <CLUB NAME> failed to ensure that directors, players, officials, employees, servants, representatives attending any match do not behave in a way which is improper, offensive, violent, threatening, abusive, indecent, insulting, or provocative contrary to FA Rule E20.1. This refers to the allegation that <BRIEF DETAILS OF INCIDENT> or similar.

The Association intends to rely on the following information, included in the charge evidence document:

1. Report(s) and information supplied by the Match Official(s)

2. Statements from <CLUB 1>

3. Statements from <CLUB 2>

If any charge is found Proven the Commission will refer to The FA Sanction Guidelines and relevant FA Regulations when deciding on the sanction. They will also take account of any mitigating or aggravating factors. The Commission may deviate from the sanction guidelines where necessary, but where a mandatory minimum sanction is stated in FA Regulations, they cannot go below this. The relevant sanctions are listed below:

<NLS – Low, £0-100, Mid, £100-£200, High £200-£400>

<Outside NLS - Low, £0-70, Mid, £70-£140, High £140-£300>

<Youth - Low, £0-£50, Mid, £50-£100, High £100-£200>

If a personal hearing is requested, this is likely to be heard on a weekday evening on a date selected by the County FA. A written response should be submitted with the response to the charge if a personal hearing is requested, along with any dates within the next month that would be unsuitable for the hearing.

Please see links to useful guides:

Disciplinary Sanction Guidelines – https://bit.ly/3xR4tzd

Grassroots Disciplinary Guide – https://bit.ly/3WsC9eP

Hearing Support Guide – https://bit.ly/3LoWNHz

offerEducationOrder.notes: This is important to complete the education order for the charges imposed within the dedicated time
